results.title: Perceptions
results.creator_credit: Paul White and AV Unit Production
results.brief_description: This video explains the background, motivations and dilemmas of people seeking professional counselling. It moves from the counselling session to the social context, allowing the viewer time to reflect on the psychological, social and political factors involved. For the professional helper this reflection can lead to new insights into often familiar situations. This holistic overview is an invaluable guide to those involved in analysis and intervention in a wide range of client problem areas. Areas covered include old age, racial harassment, bereavement, homosexuality, single parenthood and disability.

results.title: Pepita's surprise: birthday at Patzcuaro
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Visual Education Films
results.brief_description: People of the picturesque region of Patzcuaro, Michoacon, Mexico as seen in their natural environment. On the occasion of a birthday excursion by Pepita and her father an intimate family fiestas is prepared for her while she is away. Musicians play the traditional birthday song “Las Mananitas” and the delighted small friends and neighbours play at breaking pinata; climax occurs when Pepita is presented with a three day old burro.

results.title: Peoples of China
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: The film is a study in social geography. Looks at traditional China, and the China of today, illustrated with scenes from city and country life;”Age level: Secondary”

results.title: Peoples of Canada
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling and Associated Screen Studios
results.brief_description: Through the centuries people of many diferent nations have come to Canada, and, in settling there, have added their national traditions to Canada’s. Tolerance, mutual understanding and compromise between differing points of view have cemented people with diverse backgrounds into a hard-working, self-reliant, nation. Mines, farms, fisheries and industries have grown from the collective efforts of the Canadians. Includes historical footage of rural Quebec. Narrated by Rupert Caplan.

results.title: People, people and place: the impact of a new industrial complex
results.creator_credit: Neil Barrett and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This case study of Portland Aluminium looks in detail at the political and economic wrangling to establish a large industrial complex in Australia (Victoria). We talk to leading politicians, company officials, and local government officers on the impact this considerable industry has had on the local region, its state, and on Australia.

results.title: People soup
results.creator_credit: Alan Arkin, Marc Merson, Learning Corporation of America and Pangloss Productions
results.brief_description: This charming fantasy of two young brothers and the messy green concoction which transforms them for a moment into a chicken and a large sheepdog is presented with a child’s wide-eyed trust and conviction. Their conversation concerning ingredients and their coming to terms for participation in the experiment are hilarious. Written and directed by noted film-maker and actor, Alan Arkin, and using his two sons as actors.

results.title: People of Venice
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film of contrasts: a workingman’s family living today against the magnificent background of Venice’s past. Tony Biasi and one of his sons repair the big diesel boats that transport passengers on the canals. Sergio, another son of school age, enjoys the everyday life of a Venetian boy, helping a friend transport vegetables, rowing on the canals, and helping with family chores.

results.title: People of the Waikato
results.brief_description: A description of the Waikato River in New Zealand’s North Island and Lake Taupo, its main source. Includes views of waterfalls and rapids, hot springs, and geysers in Waikato thermal valley and hydroelectric schemes.

results.title: People of the Peace
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A summary and analysis of the Peace River district showing the economic factors necessary for an integrated and prosperous development. It is a warm and human story of change from primitive sod-busting to modern, mechanized agriculture and industry, and a tribute to the pioneer spirit which still finds scope in our northern settlement fringe.
